answers.answer: your numbers look excellent!  Be sure to post the quantasure plus soon as you get it.  I got my money on continued UND.wyntre
Those numbers look GREAT!!! Got the first big one down!!! Do you know the sensitivity of that test??Congrats!! You are going to start the New Year UND!!!!

I believe the last time that I had bloodwork done through LabCorp, that the sensitivity was <10.  But you know I truly cannot remember, WONDER WHY?   LOL!  Still have a bit of that lingering!  Sometimes a good thing, sometimes not so good.  Hmmmmm..... wonder how long I can use that one?  LOLShari

If that glucose was 112 on an empty stomach, if I were you I'd follow it up in a couple of weeks or months with a retest.  That sort of number indicates pre-diabetes.  Of course, anybody can get a false reading, which is why you should do it over.If you got a 112 after eating sweets, that's probably okay, although some doctors are now saying that people who will never get diabetes maintain constant readings below 100, but 112 isn't that much higher.  Real diabetics get numbers from 200 to 500 or more.Regular doctor visits with blood work should take care of you, and if anything changes, your doctor will tell you.  BTW, if you're overweight, that's the number one cause of adult onset diabetes (aka type II).  Be well, pigeon

question: Well, I had my 4 week post tx blood work on Monday.  Got some of the results this morning but not the Magic one!  DA*&it!WBC 4.0Hemo14.1RBC 4.14Paltelets 214Lymphs 15HEmatocrit 41.9Lymphs .6 little lowglucose 112 - cant remember if I had sweets or not LOL!AST 21ALT 16HCV Quantasure Plus - WILL FOLLOWBeen feeling better since last shot on Nov 16th.  Still have some mood swings and can get teary but all in all feelin so much better. So, to all on tx, there is hope of feeling better!Hopefully, I will get VL tomorrow or Monday.  Dont think I can go through Xmas not knowing!Just wanted to share!Happy Holidays to all!Shari
title: some of my lab results are in!
